summary:
-	Do you think that e-mail marketing can be a cost effective way to market products and services?
-	Are you looking to grow your business by improving your customer relationship management?
-	But are you wondering if it will take much of your valuable time?

When you answered ”Yes” to at least one of these questions you’re in the right place! 

It’s my passion to help fellow entrepreneurs grow their business in the most time effective way possible. How do you ask? By automating all the routine tasks, that take too much of your valuable time with the business miracle called Marketing Automation!

Using the right software for the job your Lead Generation, Sales Funnel and Customer Communication will be automated resulting in:

1.	A constant influx of new warmed up leads for your sales(team)
2.	A sales funnel that gives you clarity where every lead and customer is in the sales process
3.	A time effective way to communicate with leads and customers that increases customer loyalty
4.	And depending if your business allows it, direct sales from your e-mail campaigns

In short Marketing Automation will give you the means to grow your business from where you are to where you want to be. 

So book an appointment with me and tell me your vision, so we can see if we can make it happen!

https://www.crmontzorgt.nl/contact/

profile_positions.description:
Client Lab is a company I started some time after the success of ActiveCampaign Manager with a lot of experience with installing, managing and growing contact lists. 

I noticed that a lot of company's I worked with setting up their email marketing software would benefit from a review and overhaul of their sales process. 

From this idea, Client Lab was started. To give a refreshing look on current sales practices and installing marketing and sales software to streamline and automate this new way of working as much as possible.

Our vision is making improvements in the sales process accessible for every organization, from small business ready for growth, to big companies that want to increase their revenue and streamline their processes using the right kind of software.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
CRM Ontzorgt is a young and dynamic company with a lot of experience in the world of Marketing Automation, Email Marketing and CRM services. Using the right software we help your company grow from where you are to where you want to be by automating routine tasks.

However, making the right software choice is not that straight forward. CRM Ontzorgt helps evaluate your unique situation so you can make the right decision. Our service ensures you and your software van grow together to new heights.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
ActiveCampaign Manger is a young company with a lot of experience with installing, managing and growing ActiveCampaign accounts. 

Our vision is making marketing automation accessible for every organization from a one person business ready for growth, to big companies that want to optimize their processes.

ActiveCampaign marketing automation software in combination with the services of ActiveCampaign Manger makes starting with (email) marketing automation effective and affordable.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
By combining both our strengths in this strategic partnership Anglers and CRM ontzorgt strengthen their position. Anglers who have developed a strong strategy for realizing growth using a broad facet online marketing  tools and platforms has a dedicated partner for their Marketing Automation and Costumer Relationship projects in CRM ontzorgt. While, CRM ontzorgt has a partner who assists in the brother marketing ideas.
This combination of broad marketing knowledge and specified Marketing Automation expertise gives customers from both CRM ontzorgt and Anglers the guaranty of the best possible results.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Automation Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Yeast production process improvement
	A diverse project where several optimization strategies were tested, working with a scale down process. Strategies were based on micronutrient medium optimization and molasses consistency optimization. 
 	
	Fragrance production in dual layer fermentation
In this feasibility study, a for the production organism toxic fragrance molecule is produced and captured in the second layer. Several medium compositions and carbon sources were tested for optimal performance. Aside from this there was close cooperation with the DSP department to improve isolation of target molecule.

Used techniques: (Fed)batch fermentation, dual-layer fermentation,  NH4 analysis, glucose analysis, dry weight analysis
profile_positions.title: Senior Fermentation Technician

profile_positions.description:
The responsibility’s in this function were dived in two main categories. Performing small scale tests of issues encountered in production. Performing initial experiments on New Product Introduction protocols. The NPI process testing involved running the experiment for the first time in pilot scale, testing operator procedure, DSP of product.

Used techniques: working under GMP conditions and clean room environment.
profile_positions.title: Associate Scientist Bioprocess Development

profile_positions.description:
In this function I was part of a team of trouble shooters performing 24-hour active support in case of equipment failure and process related question of production processes. Additionally, I managed several projects related to equipment introduction and work flow optimisation. Developing operator training and training operators on the job was also part of the work package.

Used techniques: working under GMP conditions and clean room environment.
profile_positions.title: Manufacturing Process Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Develop new D-lactate production organism and fermentation strategy
In this project, a broad range of experiments were performed to develop a new production organism. KLA values needed to be established for the used fermentation system. Optimal pH, temperature and feed regime were determined, followed by reducing fage sensitivity of the strain and flocculation experiments. 
	
Optimisation of the FDCA production process
In this project I was involved in a wide range of experiments ranging from feasibility to pilot plant implementation. On small scale several strains, medium, substrates and feed regimes were tested. During the scale-up phase I was co-responsible for the tech transfer and on location trouble shooter during the initial pilot pant experiments.
 			
			Lab manager activity’s
Ensuring daily lab work could be performed smoothly. Arranging maintenance of fermenters and peripheral equipment, ordering of chemicals and disposables. Constant improving of working methods and lab environment/safety was achieved by regular management meetings.


Used techniques: (Fed)batch fermentation, HPLC, NH4 analysis, glucose analysis,  precipitation/centrifugation.
profile_positions.title: Fermentation Technician B / Lab manager

profile_positions.description:
Devising, execution, optimization and data analysis of fermentation processes for the production of different products. The analysis of (by)products and DSP of the final product produced during the fermentation. 

Used techniques: (Fed)batch fermentation, HPLC, NH4 analysis, precipitation/centrifugation.
profile_positions.title: Junior fermentation engineer (BIRD Engineering)

profile_positions.description:
Department of Cell Biology and Genetics. DSB repair research. 

During this internship RAD51 protein was cultured in E. coli and purified using several chromatography, dialyses and filtration methods to characterise the RAD51 protein complex stability under different conditions.

Used techniques: batch fermentation,  affinity- ionexchange-chromatography, gel filtration (Akta), dialysis, SDS-page, EMSA, thin layer chromatography, strand-invasion assay, filter binding assay,
profile_positions.title: Technician (internship)

profile_positions.description:
Department of Paracytology. 

This internship project was focused on improving AMA1antibody quality which was reduced due to intracellular protease that were released during the fermentation process. This was achieved by optimising fermentation conditions. To verify protein quality produced protein was purified using different chromatography and ultrafiltration steps. Purified antibody quality was tested using a self-developed qualitative ELISA method.

Used techniques: batch fermentation, ion exchange-chromatography, protein concentration using an ultra filter, SDS-page, ELISA, PCR, microbiology techniques.
profile_positions.title: Technician (internship)
